channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024021458
item.description:
Report X-2024021458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021458 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet in the unload and brought back to the cage DescribePack: the bottom of the box is wet DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: it was put into a plastic line totes and placed in the hazmat cage. 2. X-2024021459 SequenceEvent: box was found wet in the unloads. the inside of the box looked like a gallon of the fluid had been drained DescribePack: the box was wet on the bottom DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put in a plastic lined tote and placed in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021285
item.description:
Report X-2024021285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WALKED BY BOXLINE AND FOUND A LEAKING HAZ MAT. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND PUT THE LEAKING HAZ MAT IN A SPILL TUB AND TOOK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA FOR FURTHER COMPLETION.

item.title: Report X-2024021163
item.description:
Report X-2024021163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON OUR UNLOADING DOCK LEAKING. THE ADMIN PLACED THE HAZMAT INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINS FOUR 1 GALLON PLASTIC JUGS OF WRIGHT-GIEMSA STAIN WHICH ONE OF THE JUGS HAS A CRACK IN THE BOTTOM CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT SOAKING THROUGH THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEM WAS PLACED IN A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE UNDAMAGED ITEM HAVE BEEN REPACKED SO THEY MAY BE RTS.

item.title: Report E-2024020492
item.description:
Report E-2024020492

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: SIKESTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PRETRIP INSPECTION ENROUTE DRIVER DISCOVERED SMALL RELEASE OF MATERIAL FROM DOME COVER AREA AT TOP OF TANK. INVESTIGATION FOUD SHIPPER PERSONNEL DID NOT CONFIRM DOME LID HAD A GASKET BEFORE CLOSING AND SEALING DOME COVER. SPILL CLEANED UP BY DRIVER. DELIVERY MADE WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2024021075
item.description:
Report X-2024021075

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE 6.5 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE SGX NYC PIECE MAKER BEACHY TEXTURE SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING.
